data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In order to avoid falling, a person should always face forward. If you walk backwards, you will fall. If you walk forward, you will go from left to right. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps. Turn around. Attempt to go straight. Turn right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 6 steps and take 4 steps, you’ll take 6 steps to take another start to the beginning point. If you take 4 steps and take another start to the starting point, you’ll take 4 steps to turn around and take 10 steps to return to the beginning point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left and take 5 steps. The instructions say take 7 steps, take 1 step, then take 7 steps, and turn left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To take 5 steps back to the starting point, you would have to repeat the first step multiple times. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow these instructions, your turn around is the same and you are back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow the instructions correctly, the starting point is the same as now. Thus, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Any given sequence should only take a certain number of steps in a given sequence. Once you have taken 6 steps and turned around, you take 8 steps next. If you take twice that many steps, you take 8 steps next and take 2 at the beginning. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Always face forward. Take a step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking 3 steps isnt the same as taking 9 steps. So, the answer is no.

Take 3 steps forward and you will take 1 step backward. So, the answer is No.

Take 2 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Forward facing is the way to go. Forward facing is the way to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One of the steps forward is not leading to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You should always face forward before facing reverse. Left is the same as forward. Left is an inward. So, the answer is No.

If you went back to start point, would you make the same changes as the previous round?. The answer: no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You could not take 6 steps for the same time as taking 10 steps and turning around. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and turn right. Turn around and turn around. Turn around and turn right. The starting point is on the left. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If one leaves, they are essentially back to the starting point. The instructions say they can take 1 step, take 2 steps, take 9 steps, and take 7 steps. So, the answer is No.

Turning right results in 7 steps. Turning to the right return to starting point. So, the answer is No.

Taking 3 steps to turn the road right is the same as taking 3 steps to turn the right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Reversing a direction takes 3 out of 10 steps. You take 2 steps and two more steps. It has to be returned in reverse after turning around. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can go back one step more. If it has changed position then you can take 4 steps. It is better to start a new step than to return to the previous step. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are facing forward, you are not facing backward. To return to the starting point, the same sequence may be repeated five times. In this sequence, one walks backwards five times; one walk forward five times; and one walk backward seven times. Every step of the sequence leads to a different destination. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward you cannot go backward. Reverting to the original position of facing forward is invariably counter-intuitive. Invariably facing forward would lead you back. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow the instructions, you may or may not turn around. 4 steps – it's part of the direction. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first should always be facing forward. If one goes left, they should always take 6 steps left and leave the next one at the same time. The first should always be facing right and leave the next step 2 + 8 steps left. They should always take 6 steps right and leave the next one at the same time. So, the answer is no.

The starting point is located on the right side of the road and takes 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you face forward, you will not face backward in these commands. Whenever you step in the direction that you want to go, the direction should be facing forward with the right foot. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One step is the same as 1 step and one step cannot be the same as the beginning point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
With the number 9, one takes 9 steps. One then turns around, he return to the first point he came to. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always make a straight line in a direction with no turns. After taking 7 steps backward - from your starting point, you always make a straight line in the opposite direction of where you started, so you always make a straight line in a direction with no turns is the opposite direction of where you fended off from starting - you can not make a straight line in a direction that is in the opposite direction from where you started because it is to the opposite direction from where you started from - this is just an example but it is a general rule. If you take 10 steps right, you always make a straight line in a direction with no turns, instead of an alternate way of going around a corner or walking in circles. So, the answer is no.

The instructions are to take 7 steps by using the directions given in the first one and the first one to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

It is a misdirection to always face forward. It is a kind of reversal. It is a wrong way to go. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To begin, your body facing forward, do first 5 steps left and one step backward. When you've taken 6 steps, you are in first to first step left, then take 8 steps left and 2 more steps backwards. So, the answer is yes.

You cannot take all of these steps backward in one step. The first three steps are completely forward and to the right of the first step. The third step is backward and only takes a few steps. The fourth step is backward and only takes 2 steps return. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward you will not be facing backward. One side of you face the forward direction, while the other faces the back. In order to return to the starting point, you must take 6 steps forward, 4 steps forward, and 1 step backward. Each action begins with one step forward. Now when you face forward you will be facing backward. If you do not return to the starting point after you are facing backward, you will get back a step or two down. So, the answer is no.

You always face forward when you start a new life. If you face right, you take 7 steps left, 8 steps right and 10 steps backward. If you look to the left, you take 7 steps left, 8 steps right and 4 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.
